editorial_summary.overview: Sports and leisure complex with 25m and teaching pools, a gym, workouts and kids' dance classes.

reviews.text: The pool is good for children, with a gently sloping floor and lots of water spouts and fountains. The waves came on twice during our hour session, which was fun. The changing rooms were a bit tired out, but it's a council pool with high turn over so not too surprised. Overall good experience with friendly staff. Will definitely return.

Had to drive to this leisure centre as my local one is that bad I'm never returning.
Parking was a breeze with lots of signs about towing etc. We were reminded by staff to check in the rego upon arrival.
Rooms were warm, but large changing rooms for families can be at a pinch to get. Lots of lockers, but byo padlock. We could fit a three person family in the locker ok.
Water was warm and there is a sauna in the corner. This is more family oriented, so be warned. Olympic hopefuls don't bother. I used to crack 5 mile / 8km a session, eight times a week. This is not a pool for that kind of effort.
Great for kids and young families.
Disappointing to see people leave waste behind in the change rooms. Stay classy people. Leave it the way you find it.

Staff have always been cool in my experience. The cafe has always been way too expensive but that’s owned independentlY.
The reason I dropped 2 stars is because the pool is closed off after 3pm.
When kids come out school at 3:30.
I used to take my girls here after school during hot days to cool off for a couple of hours but now you can’t do that. Only weekends or if I took them outta school for a day which isn’t happening. It’s just a shame. Maybe look into an opening like Tuesday and Thursday open to public swim until 6pm. Balance it for everyone.
There’s money to be made both ways and kids need to cool off.
Please guys
Thanks
The pool is great for a family fun. Great space for every ages and changing rooms are clean. There also some waves at different time which are a great fun

I’ve been here twice with kids and friends, the pool is great. My kids love the new play area, the beach approach is great for my baby niece and my preschoolers love the wave machine.
Changing rooms - not big enough for the numbers of people coming and going,  and anyone sensitive to noise will get a sensory overload because of the hair dryers. I was desperate to leave. Group change locked for the holidays and not enough family changing rooms. Apparently the buggy park is upstairs- this is too far for harassed parents.
The cafe is upstairs, initially it looks pleasant, is big and overlooks the pool. It has a softplay which the kids loved.They are very strict about no outside food and where you can and can’t leave your buggy. I’m fine with sticking to rules but the woman working there was incredibly uptight and unfriendly, and service was quite slow. I think i’d rather just be charged for softplay and left alone

address: Burns Rd, London SW11 5AD, United Kingdom
